column4: Guys is possible to configure the Xorg or something to make Ubuntu just Ignore my second Grafic card?
it may be, but is is possible to deactivate the card in your cmos/bios?
In fact i'm using the second on windows to put the Physx to work so I can't deactvate it :(
ohh, hmm. let me see if i can dig something up
thanks man
is that second card a built in card, a nvidia, a amd, intel, sis?
The first one is an ATI card and the second is an Nvidia
sudo nvidia-glx-config disable might work.
let me try
sudo: nvidia-glx-config: command not found
i was afraid of that. either that command is ancient, or the nvidia driver was never installed, im assuming the first option.
did you install both drivers?
the Nvidia driver is not installed because when i Install it the ATI  driver  goes crazt
i have to install the Nvidia or Ati driver First?
considring that amd/ati has little or no support for any linux based distro, i kinda undertsand that. just switched to nvidia for that reason
what disadvantage would you have to using your nvidia card instead of your ati? is there  a big performance difference?
Iwas afraid of that because the ATI drivers is an HD5870 and the Nvidia is an 9600GT its a huge diference

well. hmm. i would think that you would need both drivers installed, and then wuold need to have ubuntu not use the nvidia. but im not an expert. one other possibility is, pclinuxos 2010 or 2009 (2009 if it is an older ati card). pclinuxos is not my favorite os, but has special support for ati, way more than ubuntu
ok i'm going to take a look about it thank you man xD
dot know how much help i have been, but, hope it works out for you
just out of curiosity, after installing the nvidia driver, did you try that old nvidia disabling command? that might have come with the nvidia driver
true i did not let me try
BluesKaj  i'm going to reboot and see if it works be back soon
